author: {'steamid': '76561198088050136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1704481732}
review:
Yet another piece of a emulation hidden behind a cute main menu, Dotemu once again delivers a bad port with introduced input lag that does not allow me to press on reaction, in a shmup game if I may add where bombing and bombing are crucial to your survival. Instead of getting the Sega saturn port, which ran at 60 fps and had more eye candy to enjoy, we received the mobile port on PC. 
Other than that, you get TWINKLE STAR SPRITES, an old versus-shmup from the NEOGEO library, which despite its genre, does serve us some chunks of single player hours thanks to its replay value, which is even enhanced with the added online leaderboard. Each play session would cost you aprox. 15 minutes, provided you don't lose a life. Still, this arcade port does not come with the tutorial and turbo shooting, both of which were part of the arcade experience if you care about it.

Another core option that is badly implemented is the difficulty modifier. Even though this game is a port of the MVS version of the game, which had a difficulty modifier in its BIOS, the configurations will always lock it to normal mode. 

And don't even get me started on the multiplayer experience, the already base input lag gets even laggier even in local multiplayer, making my multiplayer experience totally unplayable.

Still, I would highly recommend against this version of the game and instead forward you to the GOG version. This product suffers from lazy port shenanigans and comes with extra bugs that haven't been fixed as of yet. 4/10 This port sucks for a 10/10 game, I only bought it because I like shmups and wanted to get some nostalgia fuel, if you are a new player: just GOG it and pray that SNK considers reworking this with the efforts CodeMystics, as they are known for doing a good homework.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282631979', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1696906147}
review: Massive amounts of slowdown and frame drops. The music in menus and cutscenes will also slow down and start back up and sounds very choppy. But the slowdown during gameplay makes it unplayable. Buy this on GOG or Humble Bundle instead, because those versions are an emulated ROM instead of this native port here, and you will be able to swap out the emulator it's running on to get good performance. This is just a terrible port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1497739281}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097226418', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1681164800}
review:
Terrible emulation and performance.
Just run it on MAME, it's a much better experience.

Regarding the game itself though: It's great. Very fun experience, and even better in battle mode. Play with a friend, you won't be disappointed.

review:
Doesn't work on Steam Deck :
Starts with audio but displays black screen.
Please fix it !

Power > Switch To Desktop

author: {'steamid': '76561198150349905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1666108197}

author: {'steamid': '76561198810894708', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1677062765}
review:
Touhouless Phantasmagoria of Dimensional Dream. The game itself is really good but this port in particular isn't, Fightcade (and y'know any other emulator) does this game way more justice.

Edit: I recently discovered that not only is there an Arcade Archives port of this game, but it is also on the Microsoft Store (yes I know). That port is now my preferred version of the game and I'd recommend it to anyone looking to buy Twinkle Star Sprites. (Still better off using Fightcade for multiplayer though.)

Edit 2: Apparently there is ALSO an ACA NEOGEO port for Mobile, unsure if it's good but it has to be better than the Steam one lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091677219', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1656947635}
review:
I gotta stop buying games without looking at the reviews first.

If it looks like a duck, swims like a duck, and quacks like a duck, then it probably is a duck. The same goes for Steam games: if 7 out of 10 people say that a specific game on Steam is a horrible port despite the game itself actually being good, chances are the Steam port isn't going to run very well. And I'm not even talking about the negative reviews, even the positive ones mention the fact that this game will randomly lag/stutter/slow down frequently no matter how good your PC is.

Fine game, awful port. If you're interested in Twinkle Star Sprites, tell your good old friend Google and find any other platform to play it on that isn't Steam and you will probably have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054461982', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1639871433}
review:
Love the game, BUT I couldn't make it to work without help of the community, by the default it just would launch. 
steam's launcher doesn't help diagnose problems, so i had to figure out I had to find the game .exe so I could discover that it was missing MSVCR120.dll, and then install Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013 ( vc redist x86, even tho i am on a x64 system ).
the performance is laggy in places and i'm not sure if it's because of the emulation or if the real arcade game was really like that...
the controls, by default the button configuration was really bad and after i configured it, it refused to accept when i mapped start to the start button, it would just pause if i pressed both start or select. had to map it to the circle button.
and now the game just closed itself after I left it idle for a few minutes, I'm assuming it's because the game killed itself because the controller turned off. ( and i was at the last boss.... )

author: {'steamid': '76561198415269276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1639167561}
review:
The only reason to buy this game is if you are playing this game via emulation and want to give the developer some money for that.

This version has slowdown issues when there are too many things on the screen.  This is caused by the poor emulator DotEmu.  The arcade rom under FinalBurnAlpha (Retroarch) works just fine without slowdown.  There is no way to savestate in this version so you kinda get that authentic arcade experience except that the insert coin flasher has been removed for this version.  Instead, you get unlimited continues, but I actually feel like a part of the authentic experience was been taken away because of this absence.  There was an animated intro that was made for the Sega Saturn, but it is NOT included in this version.  Digging through the files, you'll find a resources folder with fonts, background images, and the menu music, which might be worth something for theming your desktop, but the images aren't the right resolution or proportion to use as backgrounds.  For some reason, there are Metal Slug X images in the backgrounds folder.  

Even with the 50% discount at $3.99, I feel like with SIX previous re-releases, the company has just over milked this title to a shameful extent.  Sure, the game is adorable and entertaining, but it has paid for itself so many times over since 1996 that releasing a digital-only straight emulation of the original with poor performance and without extra content, even extra content that was already made for previous remakes, is straight up hungry ghost levels of greed.

author: {'steamid': '76561199085857048', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2746, 'last_played': 1614080794}
review:
I LOVE Twinkle Star Sprites. IMO, it's the best versus arcade puzzle-shooter.

The reason why I don't recommend THIS version is because it's a horrible port by DotEmu. 
If you play this, even on a high end PC, you'll experience ridiculous lag. 

Half of the time you loose is because the game froze for a second making you appear somewhere else when it unfreezes, usually in the way of projectiles. Even if you try to avoid landing somewhere dangerous by "moving" while the screen is frozen, the game doesn't detect your input, so it's useless. You'll loose because of this... especially in the latter stages where the screen is filled with tons of fireballs, explotions, enemies, etc... This port makes it extremely unfair and unplayable at times. 

I still have fun with it because I love the gameplay and developing skill pays off with a good experience in multiplayer matching (the few times I don't loose because of the port's flaws).

Amazing arcade game. Worst port I've played in my entire life.

Buy in discount only if you know what you're getting into, otherwise get a physical copy or play it using an emulator. I recommend the Sega Saturn version. It includes bonus content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209319167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1607887900}
review:
TwinkleStar Spirits est un jeu qui est sorti Ã  l'origine en 1996 sur la Neo Geo. Le jeu se dÃ©roule sur un Ã©cran vertical que chaque joueur se dÃ©place sur un Ã©cran sÃ©parer. Votre objectif est de tirer sur des ennemis pour faire des combos en envoyant des boules de feux contre votre adversaire pour vider sa barre de vie. Le premier joueur qui perd tout ses points de points aura automatiquement perdus. Les contrÃ´les sont les suivants. Le bouton A sert pour tirer, le bouton B sert pour lancer une bombe, maintenir le bouton A enfoncer sert pour faire un tir charger et le joystick sert pour dÃ©placer votre personnage. Pour envoyez des boules de feux contre votre adversaire, vous devrez faire le plus de combos possible en tirant sur sur le plus d'ennemis possible consÃ©cutifs. Plus vous ferez de combos, plus vous lui envoyez des boules de feux sur son Ã©cran. Et si vous rÃ©ussissez de faire plus de vingt combos, vous lui envoyez un boss qui va le nuire. La partie se termine automatiquement dÃ¨s qu'un joueur Ã  perdus tout ses points de vies. (La seule faÃ§on pour regÃ©nÃ©rÃ© des points de vies, c'est en infligeant des dommages Ã  votre adversaire.) Pour ce qui est du mode solo, vous avez le droit Ã  2 vies avec des continues illimitÃ©s. Le jeu se compose de 7 niveaux (Les niveaux 5 et 6 sont identiques). Vous pouvez Ã  3 mode de jeux. Le versus mode qui est le mode 2 joueurs, le characters mode qui est comme le mode versus en solo et le Story Mode qui vous jouez avec la hÃ©roÃ¯ne principale du jeu. (Je vous conseille de jouer en mode solo pour jouer avec le personnage de votre choix.)
 
TwinkleStar Spirits n'est pas si mauvais que Ã§a Ã  jouer. Mais il est ou le problÃ¨me avec ce jeu? On va commencer d'abord avec les points nÃ©gatifs. Tout d'abord, le Story mode est complÃ¨tement inutile et vous empÃªche de jouer avec le personnage de votre choix, le 2e points c'est que le jeu est trÃ¨s rÃ©pÃ©titif. On a l'impression de refaire les mÃªmes niveaux en boucle. Je reconnais que les environnement sont bien variÃ©s pour chaque niveau, mais le jeu manque sÃ©rieusement de variÃ©ter d'ennemis. C'est juste qu'ils ont changer le design des ennemis selon le thÃ¨me du niveau. Par exemple, le premier niveau sont des oiseaux, le niveau 2 vous affrontez des coquillages et le niveau 3 des nuages. Le 3e points est la visibilitÃ© qui est dans la moyenne Ã  cause que parfois qu'il y,a trop d'Ã©lÃ©ments en mÃªme temps sur les 2 Ã©crans. Et on ne voit pas de changement dans le niveau de difficultÃ© parce qu'on a plus l'impression de gagner par la chance. Le 4e points c'est qu'il y'a 2 niveaux identiques qu'on refait 2 fois consÃ©cuifs le niveau 5 et le plus gros point noir, c'est que TwinkleStar Spirits est plus conÃ§u pour jouer Ã  plusieurs joueurs que tout seul. C'est unes des raisons pourquoi je n'ai pas eu beaucoup de plaisir de jouer Ã  TwinkleStar Spirits sur PC. Et avec tout Ã§a, les niveaux sont parfois trÃ¨s courts quand uns des joueurs perd trÃ¨s rapidement ses points de vies. Je ne vous cache pas que j'ignorais qu'il existait des shoot'em'up qui sont plus conÃ§u pour jouer Ã  plusieurs joueurs que tout seul. Et cela m'avait fait rappeler pourquoi je n'aime pas les jeux casual. Pour ce qui est des points positifs du jeu, je reconnais que les graphismes sont beaux, les musiques sont de bonnes qualitÃ©s, la jouabilitÃ© est trÃ¨s bonne et facile Ã  prendre en main. Les personnages sont faciles Ã  diriger et ont chacun leurs statistiques diffÃ©rentes, les environnements et les dÃ©cors sont bien variÃ©s. Mais je vous prÃ©viens que si vous y'jouez seul vous n'y jouerez pas trÃ¨s longtemps. Moi je n'y avais jouer pas plus qu'une demi-heure avant de le trouver lassant. Mais ceux qui veulent jouer Ã  plusieurs en compÃ©tition entre amis, vous en aurez pour des heures. Moi qui m'attendais au dÃ©part Ã  un jeu satisfaisant, mais au final j'ai Ã©tÃ© insatisfait. Une chance que j'avais pas fait l'erreur de l'avoir acheter sur la Saturn ou la Dreamcast qu'il coÃ»te entre 100 Ã  300$. Je ne sais pas Ã  quoi les vendeurs pensent pour vendre des jeux Ã  des prix de fous mais pour ceux qu'ils ont Ã©tÃ©s dÃ©Ã§u en payant une grosse fortune, Ã§a a dÃ» leur faire mal aux porte-monnaie. Pour conclure ce test, TwinkleStar Spirits est un jeu que seul les amateurs de shoot'em'up l'apprÃ©cieront. Ã€ condition que vous trouvez des amis avec qui y'jouez. Si c'est pour y'jouer seul, je vous dÃ©conseile fortement de vous l'achetez. Vous risquerez de le laisser ranger dans sa boite. Mais cela reste que c'est libre de votre choix de vous l'achetez ou pas.

Note: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198426286195', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1679098107}
review:
Este juego lo jugaba mucho de chico en el emulador neoragex, es uno de mis juegos favoritos de Neo Geo.

El juego es una adaptaciÃ³n casi idÃ©ntica (por no decir exacta) de la versiÃ³n ARCADE. TambiÃ©n tiene un modo multijugador online (que aunque muerto, lo he probado y se puede jugar bastante bien). Lo que veo un punto un poco en contra, es que los fotogramas bajan un poco de vez en cuando, pero es jugable casi al 100 por 100.

Para los que crecieron como yo con las recreativas de SNK, recomiendo mucho este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961029270', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1690778488}
review:
This is, by far, one of the best (if only) topdown versus shooters I've ever played.  I spent so much money at the local arcade going head to head with everyone there.

Yet, I cant recommend this.  How in the hell does this game's emulation run so poorly that I'm getting non stop glitchy and stuttering audio?  MAME emulation from like 2003 had this game running better on my old AMD Athlon desktop.

Just go get the MAME version and enjoy this how it was meant to be enjoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198805177923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1642463165}
review: Aunque es un juego de recreativa, pero se laguea mucho jugando en PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321117990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1677000382}
review:
This is probably one of the best 1v1 competitive games ever made.

I bought this game to support SNK and i don't regret it. However, i don't recommend purchase this if you are interested on a multiplayer experience.

Since multiplayer is dead, game has little replay value besides achievements unless you have a friend to play. Music plays poorly due to being synced with framerate (which never is stable even in the original game but works well there).

If you just want to play a few hours against the AI go ahead, but if you want to learn the game and play with people (where the game shine), just avoid this version and get FightCade ASAP. You will find people easily there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099336784', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1614939693}
review: An old game. Many producers may even not be alive now, but now we can still feel their passion at that time which they wanted to give us convey through the game. I think this is the romance of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980392944', 'num_games_owned': 1662, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1588314181}
review:
Twinkle Star sprites is a fun game and can be a little addictive.  It's a weird mashup of a top-down shooter and  puzzle fighters.  Give it a shot if you really enjoy old-school arcade games.

The biggest downside is that this is a dotEMU port and it shows.  Some achievements are still broken after many years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086796541', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 1291, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1559771456}
review: I got this game as a part of a bundle. Expected nothing and what I got was a nice little surprise. At first glance cuteness over dose with a girly anime style a kin to that of retro sailor moon. But then you stop and think about what your doing... Killing tons of cute and innocent birds and other cute harmless flying animals, some of them just babies. Jesus christ these cute little anime girls are monsters! MONSTERS I TELL YOU! lol XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198060561520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1560021873}
review:
Recommending it for the nostalgia, but the emulator we buy is.... kind of weird. 
We can [b]only[/b] change the sound volume, which is sad since the sound is all in mono and f***ed up.
Even if you have a powerful computer, there will be frame drops or "lag".
Again, the game is wonderful, but the emulator we buy is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198945688387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1700156273}
review:
I really love this game so I was beyond excited to see it on steam but I'm very disappointed by the lack of quality this release has. It suffers from a lot of stuttering and the music is weird in a lot of places where it shouldn't be considering that I've played other releases of this game like the nintendo switch release that does a way better job than this. 
Considering its $8.79, it's a pretty big pricetag for a game I'm going to have to tinker with to even get it to function properly when for a LOT less hassle and for the lovely price of 0$ you could just emulate it like most people do.
Hopefully this game gets some kind of update to fix its issues for users that did shell out the money for it but I highly doubt it. A man can dream...

author: {'steamid': '76561198135283509', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1710008507}
review: Amazing extremely fun game that stands the test of time.  There are problems with the emulation, but they are not significant enough to steer you away from this game.  I'm happy to see it on steam, and I hope to see more Neo-Geo titles on this platform.  The price is perfect.  Don't hesitate to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996843653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1551863165}
review: This is a tough one.  I had never played this game before. It's really fun. The port is terribly bad though. Took me twenty minutes of messing around with it, and I still had a very annoying controller issue. Anyway, if you can find this in a bundle or for $2 or less it's worth it. I'm going to go ahead and not recommend it overall though. It has too many issues, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087324447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1587950772}
review: This game is really addictive, mechanism is way simple but you get really fun while playing with friends. Even some friends of mine and my brothers like to play, one of the best things that could've been done is to make it multiplayer through internet connections, remember this is a game from 90's, I really recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037798489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1542874572}
review: This game is an interesting combination of a shootem up style game like 1942, and a puzzle game like Puyo Puyo Pop.   Things in this game aren't immedately clear mechanics wise, however once you get used to it it becomes much more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987456578', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1539757047}
review: The game itself is a classic but this is a very shoddy "port." It's basically just the arcade ROM wrapped in a fancy menu and is very buggy. It runs worse than just playing the arcade ROM in an emulator. I'm not just talking about the regular slowdown that occurs in the original arcade game, but even during navigating menus and watching cutscenes, the speed of the game is very unstable and you can hear the music slowing down and speeding back up. The achievements are also buggy and every time you unlock one, the game freezes for a second. I had to beat the story mode a couple of times for the achievement to unlock. Also, after I beat story mode, I watched the credits and the game continued on back to the real arcade ROM's splash menu where you choose between character mode, story mode and VS, exposing just how this port works and how it lacks any kind of polish. You're better off just playing an emulated arcade ROM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223565608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1538079339}
review:
Shmup oder RÃ¤tsel?
Wer Puyo-Puyo (Aka Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine) oder Puzzle Bobble im Ko-Op Kennt, der muss sich nun dieses Spiel mit einem Shoot'm Up kombiniert vorstellen - dann hat er ungefÃ¤hr die Vorstellung, worum es sich bei diesem merkwÃ¼rdigem Mix handelt. Wie in Puyo-Puyo Hat man auf der einen Seite des Screens immer einen Gegner - sei es der menschliche Mitspieler oder die KI - welcher einem das Leben schwer macht. Indem man sich auf seiner linken HÃ¤lfte des Spielfeldes in bester Cute'm Up Manier durch niedliche Pastellfarbene Gegnerhorden ballert, tut das der Mitspieler auf seiner Seite ebenso. Hierbei versucht jeder, mÃ¶glichts AbschÃ¼sse aneinanderzureihen - denn durch gute Kombos, erscheinen bei dem Gegner mehr Gegner auf dem Bildschirm, die ihm das Leben zur HÃ¶lle machen. FÃ¼r den Notfall steht jedem Shoot'm up-Ãœblich noch eine begrenzte Anzahl Smartbombs zur VerfÃ¼gung, welche zwar die Kombokette unterbrechen aber im Notfall den Ganzen Bildschirm von Gegnern sÃ¤ubern kann. Twinkle Star Sprites erschien ursprÃ¼nglich 1996 fÃ¼r das Neo Geo, SNKs leistungsstarke aber auch teure Arcade-Konsole. SpÃ¤ter folgten Umsetzungen auf zahlreichen anderen Plattformen.
Wer ein lustiges Zwei-Spieler Erlebnis sucht, was sich irgendwie auf kein Genre festlegen kann, der ist hier richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043706619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1696311794}
review:
This is a bad port of a really good game and I only own it because it was on sale and I wanted to see how active the online portion of it was.  

DotEmu is known for botching ports of Neo-Geo games and this one is no different.  While the original had slow downs this emulated version is all over the place.  You'll face slow downs that weren't in the original, odd speed ups, the music is off in many places as a result and even the intrro has glitches in it.  Online play is dead unless you arange matches through the forum which gets a new post maybe once every two months.

This is a rare game for its original console (Neo-Geo MVS) and very expensive if you own the real hardware and want to buy a copy.  I've seen them go from $300-$1,000 dollars with the higher end of the price range being more common in the last few years due to scalpers and collectors.  A lot of MVS copies were converted over to AES (home console Neo-Geo) so it's getting harder and harder to find a cartridge that isn't modified.  If you want a cabinet with original art work you're looking at $3k-$7k all together.  This game has a big cult following so a lot of folks refuse to sell the copies they have.

If you'd like to own this game the best option is the Dreamcast version which doesn't hit your wallet too badly.  The Saturn version is good as well and has things unique to it like an original anime intro but IIRC was never translated into English.  If you just want to play it your best bet is emulating it with MAME.  MAME is exactly like playing it on real hardware.  I'm an old arcade rat and own a Neo-Geo MVS cabinet and I can't tell any difference between the two when playing it on a CRT monitor.

Save your money and emulate it.  If you want to play online with other people use the Fightcade emulator.  Be warned that the lobby isn't very active but if you idle in it for long enough you'll get a game eventually.  It's a shame more people don't play this game and younger people don't know about it.  It's very fun and addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085950840', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1532114712}
review:
I have to say, there is a reason people prefer MAME on a lot of these classic titles.

DotEMU's emulation for TSS is, using a single word, terrible. It is astounding to me that I can run MAME TSS, get perfect frame rate without slowdown being introduced, whereas with the DotEMU TSS, slow down abounds. The only way this is playable? Simple. Don't even try to use full screen mode in ANY resolution.

Before anyone says "yeah, but the original had slow down," trust me, I know. My Neo Geo arcade cab with TSS installed has had an unbelievable amount of play over the years - I know and love the slow down on TSS on original hardware. OK, love may not be right but you know what I mean.

Let's talk about the music and effects. Again, DotEmu's emulation is mind bogglingly terrible. Skipping, slow down, speed up. You name any possible issue with emuated audio and this release has it in spades.

I have the Dreamcast version of TSS. That is what I would say was perfect emulation. You had the option for using arcade/AES perfect emulation, right down to the slow down AND the scoring bug. You could turn off the scoring bug. You could choose to use the DC speed processor and the slower processor whose number I currently forget. It was perfect.

This game is unplayable in its current state. My machine is not a powerhouse by any means, using an i7 from 5 years ago with an Nvidia 1070. There is zero reason for this to run THIS poorly on my machine. Heck, I'd expect perfection from an Intel Y processor. Not so here.

Avoid this port at all costs. It is not worth the money, at all.

If they ever do an ACA version on console, pick that up. ACA is emulation done mostly right while this is all wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347064855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1680272782}

author: {'steamid': '76561198428558448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1696970045}
review: This game has always had nostalgic value for me. Having played it in an arcade a long time for an extended period of time allowed me to experience this game before discovering how rare it actually was. This version has a few sound bugs, but overall this version is excellent in replicating the old school and frenetic vibe of the original arcade cab. Definitely recommend for anyone who likes shmups, or anime, or just weird games in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038982918', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1555281370}
review: One of my favorite MVS Cabinet games of the late 90's.  Pick up and play for anyone.  Easy yet hard to master.  When you have a good round going the screen becomes a beautiful bullet frenzy heaven.   Minor slow down on PC when caught up in the heat of battle. Overall a good port for a 20+ year old game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115807920', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1536105591}
review:
Before I get to my review, can we talk about queen Memory? Iâ€™m worried about her. 
Not because she has been kidnapped and brainwashed by Mevious, but because she has some pretty serious blood sugar issues. The woman is constantly Eating. Heck her win quotes almost all centre around her being hungry. (I havenâ€™t eaten in 5 minutes, Iâ€™m Starving!) 
Unless being a twinkle star sprite consumes tremendous amounts of energy, that just isnâ€™t healthy.

Anyway, Twinkle star sprites is a quirky competitive arcade shooter, with cute graphics, a catchy soundtrack, and all sorts of weird characters. 
A cat with a mech? Check. Two schoolgirls riding a giant pencil? Check. A five-year old commanding an army of giant flying pigs? Yep.
Each stage consists of shooting the enemies that come at you on your side of the screen, which turn into fireballs to lob at the other player. You also have special attacks and boss attacks to make their life miserable. 
Donâ€™t get too cocky though, because your opponent can pull a reversal and hurl those fireballs right back at you. Achievements are all doable, controls are good, and despite being simple the gameplay is quite addicting, perfect for short matches when you have a half an hour to kill. 

There are some problems though. The emulation suffers from slowdown when things get too crazy onscreen, and the soundtrack also stutters during the attract screens. 
The dialog boxes move extremely fast in Story mode and victory screens. If I need to lose to an enemy twice to understand what kind of two-line trash talk he throws at me, then the Dialog is too fast.

Pros: 
-Colorful, fun characters and Levels
-Addicting Gameplay
-Catchy Soundtrack
-Easy Achievements.

Cons:
-Some Slowdown
-Dialog boxes switch too fast

author: {'steamid': '76561198274296955', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1675973777}
review:
So you have a shooter game, but that isn't enough. You need fighting mechanics with an idea similar to Puyo Puyo! Now that sounds crazy, and it is. That is basically Twinkle Star Sprites, a game released in 1996 by SNK. This is pretty different from their other offerings (most were fighting games) and is it good? Only one way to find out.

Gameplay: So as a shooter, you obviously have your standard and charged shots, which can be upgraded by killing enemies, and you have screen-bombs when things get dicey. However, you have an opponent, but how do you beat them? Well, this is where the fighting and Puyo Puyo mechanics come in. YOu have to send their HP to 0, to do that, you gotta kill enemies in a combo, which sends things to do damage to them. This is actually a pretty cool mechanic and being good enough can do things from little dudes, big suckers, and even sending a miniboss! Getting good at this can prove really good and satisfying. Your enemy can obviously do the same, and we will talk more about the ai later. In the end, the game has a unique mechanic that works well and is fun to use.

Graphics and Presentation: WOW! That is your first impression when booting up and getting an animated intro with an anime style! It looks great, especially for the Neo Geo! It's heavily detailed and very adorable. Each character has a good design with plenty of detail. Even the areas you go to have rich colors and are great to look at, with plenty of stages too! I love it! I wish SNK went back to this to do more with this style! However, there is slowdown that was carried over from the original release. Besides that, great.

Sound and Soundtrack: There is a very happy soundtrack that is upbeat and fitting to the game's style and mechanic. It's not the most memorable, but still good to listen to. With sounds, it's just as upbeat and great, even with voice clips! Like, how else can I explain it? Wow. Heck, the OST even goes epic when needed.

Replayability: Now with this game, you can go for a high score in arcade mode, and there is a story mode, and online, but besides that, there isn't much reason to go back. The addicting gameplay can get some people hooked and it did for me, and I expect long play sessions soon. However, on features alone, there isn't too much honestly.

Final Thoughts: Well this was a short review. There actually wasn't too much to talk about as usual. I was on a time limit for this one as I did have to go eat soon, but as for now, I think this game deserves this score. However, you may have different experiences than me and have a different opinion, and that's fine, everyone has their own opinion. But as it stands, I think this game deserves an 8/10 with a side of a boss attack. It's very satisfying to play and the cutesy graphics and sound help, and is worth the $7.99 in my opinion. This Steam port is really good too, and is a lot more cheaper than the ~$400 cart for a Neo Geo. There might be other ports, but I didn't look into it as much as others. However, what about that ai?

AI: Oh SNK, when will you learn to not make cheap ai? Seriously though, as SNK standards, the ai is very cheap, but not as much as some other SNK games. Sometimes the ai makes impossible moves to avoid sent dudes, but it's not so bad... until you get to the final boss and SNK Boss Syndrome kicks in! This final boss is basically a TAS! It avoids practically everything and sends way too much. The level 1 charge attack is just.... insane. It sends shots everywhere that bounce off the sides that easily kill enemies and the boss always does long combos! Even when you do combos as long as over 20, the boss still somehow manages to dodge it all AND reflect it back! It's just absolute BULL----! Woops, I guess I went overboard. Sorry. Still, if it was not for this, this game would have easily gotten a 9/10 instead. However, SNK just decided to be SNK. Gosh darnit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066626664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1651334600}
review:
A frantic and very unique vs. Bullet Hell that's charming, and actually very challenging with deep gameplay despite its cutsey demeanor. 

Absolutely worth your time and money. Playing alone can be fun, but the game gets REALLY good when you play it with friends. This is one of those games where you and your friends will want to play each other over and over because every match is really exciting. And it's a ton of fun at parties.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021845360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1666934026}
review: An underrated masterpiece from SNK, which it's too a great company and always guarantee decent-tier games. Funny, lovely aesthetics and characters, and of course really frenetic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069211866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1514055862}
review: I love this game, played it years ago and it was highly addictive, but this is probably the worst port I've ever played. It doesn't matter how beastly your computer is, this turd is going to lag so bad in the middle of an intense fight (major fps drop, not recognized button presses). I love this game on NeoGeo but this is just a bad bad port. Don't bother buying this unless it is on a DEEP discount, and even then you would get more enjoyment out of a double cheeseburger from McDonalds (even with the rampant diarrhea afterwards)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976469467', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1680590513}
review: This is the greatest arcade game I have ever played. It is cute and fun as hell and all you have to do is focus on your side and play it like a scrolling shooter.  It's so fun and satisfying, surprisingly so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026804240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1700374289}
review:
Where the heck did this game come from!? Why is it so good? 

Take an arcade scrolling shoot-'em-up (Raiden, Strikers 1945, Galaga) , make it two player split screen. Now add the "garbage blocks " and "combo" elements from puzzle games (Bust a Move, Puyo Pop, Tetris Attack). Insert an old-school anime, pastel art style and you have TWINKLE STAR SPRITES. WHAT MAD GAME DESIGNER THOUGHT OF THIS? And where may I get more please?

author: {'steamid': '76561198029856413', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1530789914}
review:
It plays a bit like Touhou 3 "Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream". Just shoot to kill. It's cute, music is eh though. You can shoot your opponents attacks back over to them. It's kind of fun

I will recommend this game based on the fact that I have used the rom in an emulator (Thanks Humble Bundle)... however, I don't recommend this port. It slows down horribly while playing, making it impossible to dodge oncoming attacks and enemies.

DotEmu cares nothing for preserving games like this. They always seem to muck it up. Though, the Neo-Geo X Arcade Stick works with this port. In a bit of good news, it appears that they put the assembly code under "\resources\game\". If you are emu-savvy, then I would bet you can package up the rom in a correct format to make it work right on MAME or FBA without the use of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965894260', 'num_games_owned': 1544, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1503777519}
review:
Le portage n'est pas bon. Tout va bien une fois un niveau lancÃ© (c'est le principal), mais toute l'interface rajoutÃ©e par DotEmu a des soucis incroyables de ralentissement.

Je n'ai malheureusement pas pu faire une demande de remboursement alors je vous mets en garde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049117423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1499148773}
review: Take Dr. Mario and mix it with a top-down spaceship shooter and some tasty gameplay mechanics, and you have Twinkle Star Sprites. This game is a delightful gem that has been rescued from Neo-Geo obscurity by the Steam platform. 12/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052721198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1651871844}
review:
Twinkle Star Sprites est un shoot them up original.

En effet il ne s'agit plus de detruire le plus d'ennemis tout en evitant les tirs, mais de vaincre un autre joueur.
Quand un vaisseaux ennemis explose, cela impacte directement ceux qui se trouvent collÃ©s a lui.
On assiste alors a un effet d'explosion en chaine,  ce qui peut declencher plusieurs effets nÃ©gatifs pour le joueur adverse, allant du simple missile jusqu'a envoyÃ© un Boss a l'autre joueur, afin de corsÃ© le tout.
C'est un asser vieux jeu NeoGeo - Ã©galement sorti sur Saturn - qui pour moi n'a pas vraiment prit de rides et reste toujours, dans son concept, original.
Je prÃ©viens ceux qui n'y n'ont jamais jouÃ©s : les ralentissements qu'il y avait sur NeoGeo sont fidelement conservÃ©s, ce qui pourrait enerver, mais concrÃ¨tement on peut en retirer des avantages tactiques.

Je conseil donc ce jeu aux nÃ©ophites qui aiment les shmups et les conceptes originaux.
A 2 le jeu est vraiment sympa.

Je n'ai pas tester le multi, a voir donc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326833703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1513476751}
review: Very nice game to play with others! Simple shooter game and it's actually pretty cool to kill time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991179373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1557035225}
review: This is a very interesting twist on the shmup genre, turning it into a 2 player versus game.  Not terribly difficult to pick up but has enough depth to make mastery a fun challenge.  If you enjoy fighting games this might be a nice, simpler diversion, but on the whole it's just a lot of fun to play.  Great graphics and music truly help here.  The only other thing I'll mention is that the emulation (done by DotEmu) is a bit spotty, there are sound issues in addition to the speed of the game fluctuating and frameskipping.  But if you're not terribly familiar with the Neo Geo original you might be able to overlook the issues, and it's still generally playable.  Plus online play is a nice bonus (even if it doesn't always perform too well)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086380278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1572672914}
review:
Thanks for the remake. This game is wonderful. I'm never bored of playing it. Extra fun.

Saddly the remake crash often in desktop.

PS: Ok, I found the reason of the crash. I play this game with Dualshock 4 using DS4Windows software. If the controller gets disconnected the game crash. I disabled auto-disconnect option and now the game never crash.

review: I remember playign this as a little kid, so I was very excited when the PC version was released online, But I am more happy now that Steam compatibility came out as well a bit later! Personally, I think the port is fine, I do not experiance much slow down, but I am not sure what causes it for some people. Its a fun game, shooter and pretty calm shooter game, It is non punishing and very fun! Ther eare many character to play as! If fan of NEOGEO classics, It's highly reccomended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064782932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1661355402}
review:
Like all Neo-Geo rereleases by DotEmu, this is NOT a port (what's in a name, right?). This is a decompressed and slightly reformatted game ROM in a subpar emulator dressed up in a fancy menu.

Although the drop in user experience between the tacked-on menus and the actual emulated game are stark, this would all have been excusable if the actual emulation had been competent. However, it runs like trash on any visual setting, consistently hovering around 56-57 fps no matter what, causing the music to play rather irregularly and failing to stay on-beat at any time. 
It has [i]no[/i] right to perform this poorly on [i]any[/i] modern system. This is an emulation of a 21-year-old, sprite-based game, from a game system that's very well-understood and easily emulated to a high level of accuracy and performance, even as far back as 10 years ago! But somehow, the folks at DotEmu managed to work their magic again and gave us this barely coherent, zero-effort mess.

You might feel I'm a bit harsh in calling it zero-effort, but a good [i]quarter[/i] of the files in the game folder are unused, leftover files from their Metal Slug emulation, also on Steam. This should illustrate how much they cared about their product.

Play this game any other way, but stay away from this shoddy effort, if only to send a signal that this is NOT an acceptable way to do "ports" or even emulations in this day and age. DotEmu's showings in their other Neo-Geo classics and this one in particular have [i]thoroughly[/i] soured my perception of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220223668', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1488691774}
review: This is actually one of the best games of all time - no, seriously! It's an incredibly creative and fun mash-up that combines SHUMPs, puzzle games, and fighting games. Twinkle Star Sprites is one of the highlights of the Neo Geo library, and it's an absolute shame that we never got a whole bunch of sequels that expanded on this unique idea. So, it's awesome that this game is on Steam, and I'm happy that it'll get exposed to a wider audience. However, I'm very sad to say that this is a bad port. It's buggy, laggy, and has tons of slowdown. When there's a bunch of stuff on screen and when the stages start to get really tough, it's almost unplayable. The arcade original doesn't have anything close to this level of slowdown (and I acually went back to play the original machine, just to make sure that my memory was correct). There's also another big flaw here: the visuals on this port are incredbily blurry, and no amount of fiddling with the resolution settings was able to do any good. For some reason, the menu screens look sharp and crisp, but then the game itself looks like faded garbage. You can actually see this in the sample images at the top of the game's Steam page - the "Let's Start" intro screen looks nice, and then the in-game screenshots are blurry and dull. You should *definitely* play this game at some point, but not like this. This port is a disservice to the original game...and you're asked to pay waaay too much for it. Skip this port and find a way to play the game in some other form.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1483240536}
review:
https://youtu.be/2H-I4cnu94E

A vertical scrolling shooter from the old NEOGEO days attempts to apply that gameplay into a versus format.  The split screen layout greatly reduces the individual play space and unlike other more common puzzle versus games, this one fails to make the adversarial nature feel natural.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126369360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1478035980}
review:
so is this game a good game? hell yeah, this game is super fun. a competitive shmup with puzzle elements which works like a charm. its colourful too and has a nice aesthetic, and a good soundtrack. each character plays a bit differently too, different shot and movement speeds, of course each character has a different charge shot and bombs, standard affair with a shmup.

is this port a good port? absolutely not. this port has slow down and that ive never had happen when playing this on fightcade or supercade (when it was still around). like, the game does have slow down naturally here and there when theres a whole bunch of projectiles on screen, but with this port it happens a lot more frequently. it even happens when some characters throw out a bomb, especially with memory. and when i say slow down i mean the game chugs to like, 5 frames a second, basically unplayable until the slow down decides to stop. it's also got a weird issue with sound where certain instuments will sometimes not sync up with the other ones.

i bought this when it first came to steam just for the sake of throwing some money at ADK/SNK and letting them know there is still interest in a game like this one. but this port is terrible. like if you wanna buy it then go on ahead but this port isnt worth Â£5.59, not by a long shot. just go play it on fightcade instead, you'll even get people to actually play it with there, the lobbies on the steam port are always dead and for good reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999363278', 'num_games_owned': 3013, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1477275207}
review:
Really good arcade game that really needs a modern reinterpretation. 

Pretty much a mix of  a competitive puzzle game (think puyo puyo or puzzle fighter) and a shmup. It is better than it sounds. It is a  TON OF FUN.

But this is a dotemu relatively shoddy port. Or at least I do not remember it having such a terrible amount of slowdown.  Basically, I am glad this exists, but like the DotEmu metal slug ports, I wish they were better emulated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966868842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1643052621}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053508326', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1502057779}
review:
the default video settings were a mess to clean up when i first started the game being a resolution and aspect ratio that didn't play nice with my monitor and clipped half the menu out of sight. 

The game seems to have a more varied selection of playable characters/vehicles than most shootemups in general. Seems to be a regular type of shootem up fused with a puzzle fighter style vs game.



phantasmagoria of flower view is a doujin bullet hell game that i'm more familiar with and comparing to twinkle star sprites: TSS is significantly harder than pofv especially as there isn't much room to maneuver around. due to playing pofv I was half expecting tss to be a bullet hell game as well but sofar it seems to be a traditional shoot 'em up. TSS doesnt need abunch of additional patches to play. All in all I was wondering if another game that was like pofv existed and here it is

author: {'steamid': '76561197994397124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1497311609}
review:
This is one of the best versus shoot'em ups ever made.

However, what you get with this re-release is an easy to use ROM+emulator bundle with some additional features. The game ROM is not even openly accessible so you cannot use it with the emulator of your choice and are stuck with the given configuration options and the given launcher.
Besides, the Neo-geo original version is not the absolute best version of the game (the Saturn version had more content).

The additionnal features are a leaderboard, multiplayer and achievements, but every one of them is flawed:
- leaderboards are very buggy (with scores superior to 9,999,999 which should be the upper limit, and I am 99% certain at least some of them are due to glitches, not cheaters)
- multiplayer does not have proper matchmaking but only a friend invite system. Fightcade does better than this and is free (free as in "free beer")
- the achievements are very buggy. They unlock at the wrong time or do not unlock at all. I have done everything needed for "All endings" twice and it did not unlock. Waste of time. I hope you are not a completionist.

tl;dr: this port is asking for too much money for almost no value added.
Alternative software such as MAME and Fightcade respectively provide superior emulation and multiplayer, given you own a dump of the original game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052965201', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1467399127}
review:
Ever wondered what would happen if you gave a bullet hell game a versus mode?
Then don't be put off by the those cutesy designs and give this a try. In a split-screen bullet hell you'll have to deal with waves of enemies, all while dodging and reversing your opponent's projectiles and keeping an eye on your POW meter, which releases your Boss attack if charged to max.
The game has multiple different characters, all with different stats, bombs, charges attacks and projectiles (well except for Dark Ran, she seems to just be a pallette swap).
I did have some VERY noticeable slow-down, but with the amount of stuff going on on-screen and the fact that my PC is in desperate need of an upgrade, I'm blaming my hardware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000942167', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1488499361}
review:
When I bought the Humble NEOGEO 25th Anniversary Bundle, I was only wanting to play games like Metal Slug and fighting games like King of Fighters, I wasn't expecting that such a unique game to come with it, but I mean really unique.

Like other reviews said, this is a mix of shmup and fighting, where defeating enemies in a shmup gameplay, sends attacks to your enemy at the other side of the screen, you can shoot these attacks back, and like usual, you can use power ups like bombs to clear the screen, you can even send a boss to fight your opponent.

Get it, it doesn't matter if you buy from Steam or Humble Bundle, just for a different gaming experience that you never seen before it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044100577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1636344376}
review:
(Got this in a Humble Bundle.)

In short, it's like Puzzle Fighter if it was actually a shmup.  Enemies explode when you shoot them, which damage other enemies and make combos.  High combos send extra attacks over to your opponent's screen (think junk puyos), and your opponent has to dodge those too.

Haven't tried the netplay added for this port, but otherwise the port seems decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071667268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1464430665}
review: MÃ©lange de SHMUP et de TÃ©tris, c'est comme cela qu'Ã©tait vendu le jeu Ã  l'Ã©poque sur Neo Geo. 20 ans plus tard, le concept n'a pas pris une ride et tient toujours autant la route. Le solo se veut surtout comme un bon moyen de parfaire son entrainement, c'est en effet en multi que le titre rÃ©vÃ¨le toute la puissance de son principe. Coups bas, ruses, retournements de situation, combos explosifs, tous les ingrÃ©dients indispensables afin de rendre chaque partie mÃ©morable . Le mario kart des SHMUP tout simplement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004155257', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1534321699}
review: Really addicting. The game really does a fair showing for Shmups, while also containing a lot of puzzle fighter elements. Creating chain explosions can lead to an avalanche of projectiles for your opponent to dodge or counter. The build up to each fight is negligible, and would only be a deterrent if you paid any attention to the story. Anyone looking for a good Shmup or Puzzle fighter will find something to like in this game; but I did run into some rather annoying issues that stilted me from higher level play. When there is too much junk on the screen, everything jumps to a crawl, and everything seems to be oddly out of sync while lagged. Needing that charge attack to counter a barrage of fire; but the bar barely charges when the entire game is lagged. I found myself dying repeatedly to this meager annoyance; but it didn't stop me from having fun. They were nice enough to give 2 extra lives, before needing to continue and losing your score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250240500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1544274214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027627028', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1467481972}
review:
Preface: I love this game, its awesome and amazing.

But this steam port wasn't as good as I was hoping. It has netplay, which is sick, but the functionality is very limited.

The only leaderboards are for 1P score.
The only way to find an opponent is to invite a friend, or hope you find a lobby: No matchmaking of any sort.
I could not find any way to interact with my opponent, couldn't tell them "gg" after a set, or even warn them that I would quit. I couldn't find a way to friend someone for more games later in the lobby.

Overall, for multiplayer, there seems to be little reason to play this version over using the rom you've just bought in fightcade, which is a bummer.

All that said though, it's an awesome core game, and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984901291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1695099432}
review:
Twinkle Star Sprites is a unique take on the shoot'em up genre. Players compete via split-screen to defeat enemies and outlast their opponent. While unable to attack each other directly, you can summon fireballs, minions or boss-monsters to overwhelm your opponent. You send more for performing combos, where defeating an enemy causes them to explode and defeat nearby enemies. Because of this mechanic proving more effective than shooting every enemy down individually or via bombs, there is a action-puzzle game feeling to the whole experience, trying to line up enemies for the largest possible combo before shooting them down.

The cute and colorful graphics and characters really give the game its charm. Each character also feels very unique in their attack arsenal and movement speeds, with decent balance among them, though some may take longer than others to get used to using or fighting against (with only the ultra-final boss possibly challenging the game balance as a secret character). For better or for worse, there is also this game's share of Engrish to explore, including having main character's name labeled as "Load Ran" (presumedly originally intended to be Lord Ran? *shrug*, it's well established to be Load Ran now)

However, there are some flaws with this game. There is currently a bug (which was also in the original) relating to scores, which is bad considering this game uses leaderboards. There are also some instances of the music stuttering or doubling up. Lag relating to overpopulating the screen with bullets/enemies has been reduced, which I would consider a good thing, but some devoted fans of the original may not approve.

For offline play, this may not be the superior release of the game, as the Dreamcast had all the the above issues addressed, including an option to change emulation speed (to reproduce lag found in the original), and an option to change music to a newer arranged selection. There was also a Saturn version which included one additional character. But those are way more expensive to purchase, and lack online play . . .

So fans who have previous versions may have to weigh whether there is much to gain from this release. But it is definitely a fun and unique cute'em up for fans of the genre, or those looking for a unique versus experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010707755', 'num_games_owned': 1091, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1588515222}
review:
Love it! My only previous experience is with the Dreamcast version and this is a huge boost in my opinion. The option for high resolutions, scan lines, and custom controls without messing around with external emulation is fantastic. I have experienced the issue, some have reported, that the selected resolution does not stay after restarting the game but all other settings have stuck (incuding custom controls). I don't think the resolution issue is a huge deal since we're dealing with a pixelated game (outside of the fancy menus). I have not experienced any of the other "bugs" or issues that people are reporting, such as audio problems or incorrect scores. Twinkle Star Sprites is still a fun spin on the usual shmup gameplay.

PROS:
+High resolution menus
+Resolution options
+Controller support
+Custom controls
+Scanlines
+Classic shoot em up gameplay with a 1v1 twist
+Online and local multiplayer
+Reasonable achievements (if you're into those)
+Leaderboards
+Cloud saves

CONS:
-Resolution choice does not stick after restart (may be patched)
-Not many people are going to be playing this game online

author: {'steamid': '76561197967284235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1496707419}
review:
EDIT 2 (6/3/16): As of a few hours ago, the game got patched. The slowdown seems to be fixed and the video options don't reset anymore. The sound seems good too. I haven't been able to test the online multiplayer again yet, but even so I can now give this port a solid recommendation. I'll leave my pre-patch review here marked though, for posterity.

Now please patch Raiden Legacy to run at 54fps and we'll be golden, DotEmu.

ORIGINAL REVIEW (Pre-patch)
This is one of my favorite NeoGeo titles, and also one of my favorite shmups ever made thanks to its unique 1v1 take on the genre. I'm very familiar with the original title as well as its Dreamcast port, and I have to say, this one on the PC is trash.

Sound emulation is very poor, when booting up the game's character select screen the audio tends to loop over itself immediately. I ran into a bug the first time I tried to play the game where my stick just stopped working for no reason (luckily only in character selection and in single player, but that's still unacceptable). Online has very noticeable input lag, feels like you're sliding around everywhere, which makes it that much more difficult to dodge incoming fire. Speaking of dodging, there seems to be very little effort put into emulating slowdown when there's too many bullets on screen, making dodging heavy attacks far FAR more difficult. This was also an issue on the Dreamcast port, but they had the sense to include a NeoGeo mode in the options which restored this slowdown.

Another mark of shame upon you, DotEmu. I'd rather play this on my hacked NeoGeo X.

EDIT: I'd like to point out that the emulation of the Humble Bundle version of this game, released just a few months ago also by DotEmu, is far superior. What happened!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198008399343', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1520227840}
review:
UPDATE: I amend my review to a thumbs up. A recent patch reintroduced the natural slowdowns of the original Neo Geo game (though it doesn't appear to be an option, unlike other ports of this game), and the resolution-settings glitch is fixed: it remembers your video settings.

The music playback is still very wonky, marring the audio from the BGM to the jingles, but otherwise this is an acceptable rendition of an excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987846406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1527610171}
review:
Fantastic Game. 

Versus shmup action that is messy, hilarious, fast paced and most importantly fun.
It's a game were you shoot patterns of enemies which create fireballs that your opponent must either dodge or return. under correct circumstances the game quickly changes from a gallery shoot to a bullet hell in a heartbeat.

I do have to admit that this is not the best version of the game. 

The dreamcast version had a series of options that fixed a few known issues, such as the score bug glitch. the slowdown and also had an option to run exclusive CD quality audio that was recorded for console releases. It is a shame that SNK continues to ignore these options that have been used in the past, espically if you concider that other dreamcast emulations have shown up on steam. 

HOWEVER

It's available. It's on steam. It has online play. The basics are still there, and if this is all we are getting at the moment then I still recommend you wet your feet on this version. If this is what it takes to bring exposure to the game then so be it.
